Hi all,

I remember some one asking if we can pass arguments from command l=
ine to a
JUnit test

I have given it some serious thought and I doesn't tak=
e long to realize the
flexibility it can provide to JUnit.

I am sending my=
 suggestion of how we can implement it.

For example, let my JUnit test cas=
e be mypackage.MyTest

We run the test using java command with command line=
 arghuments as follows:

java mypackage.MyTest arguments

In order for argu=
ments to be accessible in side MyTest, I suggest we make
following changes =
in JUnit API.

The setUp() currently accepts no arguments and is heavily us=
ed to create the
test environment. If we change its signature as follows (s=
omewhat similar to
main() ),

public void setUp( String[] args )

Please no=
te that the first element of args[] should have value "arguments"
and not m=
ypackage.MyTest followed by "arguments"

This will give a lot of flexibilit=
y to a JUnit test.

Thanks

Vishal
